messages: 405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:31): At least when Jack and Jose aren't around.

4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (09:37): arooni: I think KTQuest has questionable style :P
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:38): should i be specifying them both separately in the css
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (09:38): arooni: you could specify them with a class
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (09:38): if you want to ensure they're always styled the same
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:38): otherwise i feel like i'm repeating myself
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:38): How can two types by the same?
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:38): well the form elements are different
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:38): but i want them always layed out the same
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (09:39): arooni, <form class="foo"> and then define .foo in your css
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:39): Zeros: can i paste you what i currently have and you can tell me how to turn it into classes?
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:40): since it currently uses whati i think is css selectors
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:40): Depends -- have you been in here for at least 2 years?

405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:41): So no, you don't know me ;)

405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:43): You mean ID selectors instead of class selectors
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:43): i'm not sure what i mean to be honest
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:43): i just know i want to reuse that style for forms and labels
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:44): And use class instead of id
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (09:44): classes are reusable... IDs are not
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:44): unless the ids wont exist on one page
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:46): It's not bad, it just doesn't work
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (09:46): you can use the same ID on different pages, of course
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:47): they will never see the join box again
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:47): Good, glad we're all on the same page
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:47): unless they go to the join page
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:47): but then again, i wont reuse the ids
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:54): when you specify the height of a text input, it seems that if you resize the font the field doesnt scale
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:54): is there anyway of getting aroundthis
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (09:56): as does the rest of the fonts
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:57): If you resize the font...the text field dosen't get bigger?
405d7f86e7a56bae27702ca7c3387a7c (09:57): So you have a little field and a big font that doesn't fit in it?
